titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5007

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
☞ Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A. Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.

Frankfort, Ky., May 31st, 1864.
Hon. Tho. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.
Dr. Sir

S. W. Owens Sheriff of Ballard Co ^for 1863^ has this day paid the full Revenue due from him as Shff of said Co. for said year together with Interest and Costs, and now pray your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Two Hundred & Thirteen 31/100 Dollars (213.31/100) that being the amt. adjudge against ^him^ as "Damages" for the failure to pay said revenue in time as required by law.

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
S. W. Owens
$21331
Damages
Remit damages
Tho E Bramlette
